title: Textile, 12th–13th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: compound weft twill (samite)
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 38.7 x 49.5 cm (15 1/4 x 19 1/2 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 24.1 x 36.8 cm (9 1/2 x 14 1/2 in.)
description: Large tangent guilloche roundels with pearl guard borders, joined by small, overlaid pearl roundels, each with central rosette, with elaborate four-lobed rosettes in the interstices.  Each large roundel contains an elephant with decorative trappings and a symmetrical floral form above. In golden yellow, greenish yellow, white, dark brown and crimson, on crimson ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 12th–13th century.
12th–13th century. Medium: silk
Technique: compound weft twill (samite). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-221-a,b.
